content: Article I � Purpose

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: The South Carolina Bed & Breakfast Associationis a non-profit, voluntary organization of bed and breakfast owners representingthose Bed & Breakfasts, Inns, and B&B Homestays in the State ofSouth Carolina that are appropriately licensed. Through cooperativeeffort, these innkeepers shall work closely with state and local governmentalagencies to promote tourism, and to assure high standards of safety andservice within the bed and breakfast hospitality industry. The Associationshall act as a public resource for state and local regulatory agenciesas they govern the growing B&B segment of the industry. The Associationwill further act as a professional regulatory body for all members of theAssociation.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: The primary goals of the Association are to:

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: � Create greater recognition of Bed &Breakfasts as preferred accommodations sources within the hospitality industry.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: � Cultivate cooperation and communicationamong Bed & Breakfasts through out South Carolina.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: � Work within the industry to set standardsfor the operation of Bed & Breakfasts.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: � Serve as a resource center for Associationmembers.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: � Serve as a liaison between the Associationmembership and the State of South Carolina, State Legislature, State, Countyand local agencies, and other organizations.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: � Work to obtain reductions in operatingexpenses, such as group purchasing, for Association members.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: � Produce a newsletter, and other materials,to share information among Association members.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: � Produce and distribute an AssociationDirectory of members.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: Article II � Membership

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: Section 1: Members

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: Any person(s): (1) Who owns and operatesa Bed & Breakfast enterprise within the State of South Carolina (hereinafterreferred to as an �innkeeper�) and who meets the standards for Full Membershipestablished in these By-Laws; or, (2) meets the standards for AssociateMembership established in these By-Laws, who follows the procedures forapplying and pays the appropriate dues, shall be eligible for membershipin the Association.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: No applicant innkeeper shall be denied membershipor be otherwise discriminated against in any way because of his or herrace, religion, sex, martial status, sexual preference, age, national originor handicap. The Association shall comply in full the Revised Codeof South Carolina, �Law Against Discrimination,� and all correspondingfederal statues. Membership shall be held in the name of the Bed and Breakfastor Inn (hereinafter referred to as �Inn� or �B&B�). Certain exceptionsto this definition are defined elsewhere in these By-Laws.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: Section 2: Membershipshall be classified as follows:

content: a) Full Membership

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span

content: 1) Have voting rights (one per B&B);

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span

content: to selected individuals. These membersmay be invited to (1) participate in any meeting of the membership,Board of Directors or Executive Committee as deemed appropriate by themeeting chairperson, (2) assist in the work of the Association, (3) willnot have voting rights and (4) will not be assessed any dues or membershipfees.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: Memberships shall be considered �pending� until(a) all materials are submitted as requested, (b) and evaluative site visitis conducted, as applicable, and (c) the Board of Directors approve suchmemberships. It is expected that �pending members� shall become �fullmembers� within a period not to exceed six (6) months. Membershipsleft pending by the applicant B&B, for a period of six (6) months ormore shall be denied, unless the applicant submits a written request forapproval by the Board of Directors prior to the six month period afterreceipt of initial application.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: Section 3: MembershipMeetings

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: a) Annual Meeting

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: An Annual Meeting of the membership shall be heldin either January or February of each year to discuss general Associationbusiness, review annual reports, elect directors and officers for the upcomingyear, approve By-Law revisions, and approve the proposed budget and duesfor the year. Notice of the annual meeting starting date, place andhour shall be delivered to the membership no earlier than sixty (60) daysprior to or no less than thirty (30) days prior to the annual meeting. Each Full Member B&B shall be eligible to cast one vote or writtenballot at membership meetings. A quorum at an Annual Meeting shallbe the number of members present.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: b) Special Meetings

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: Special Meetings of the membership may be called,should the need arise, by the President, by order of the Board of Directors,or by the Secretary upon the written request of not less than twenty-five(25) members. At the direction of the persons calling the meetingwritten notice of a special meeting shall be delivered to the membershipnot less than fourteen (14) days prior to the meeting. A quorum forSpecial Meetings shall be the number of members present.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: Section 4: Dues

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: a) To provide funding for printing,mailings, meetings, and other Association activities

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: throughout the year, the membership shallpay annual dues as recommended by the Board of Directors, with theassistance of the Association Treasurer. The proposed dues structurefor the upcoming year will be approved by the membership at the annualmeeting. Dues statements will be mailed by the Treasurer at leastsixty (60) days prior to the annual meeting. Dues are payable thirty(30) days after the sttement date, but no later than the Annual Meeting. Memberships are effective from Annual Meeting to Annual Meeting.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: b) Should a member fail to pay the Association�s dues on time,the Treasurer shall

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span

content: the President, who shall make further contact with the member for payment. If

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: payment is not made within two weeks following contact by the President,the member�s

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: name shall be removed from the roster of members in good standing and allcurrent

content: certificates of membership and SCBBA Emblems shall be surrendered by theterminated

content: member.

content: Section 5: Complaints AgainstMembers

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: Three or more complaints against a memberinn, received from any source, in a twelve

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: month period concerning standards covered by Association membership shallserve as

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: cause for review by the Board of Directors for possible action.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: Section 6: Termination

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: In the event that a member no longer meetsthe standards for membership, does not meet

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: its financial obligations to the Association, or otherwise is felt by amajority of the

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: Board of Directors to be detrimental to or at odds with the purpose ofthe Association,

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: such member may be removed from the roster of members in good standing

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: Memberships may also be terminated by written resignation of the memberat any time.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: In either event any dues paid will not be refunded. Current certificatesof membership

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: and SCBBA Emblems will be surrendered by the terminated member.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: A member being considered for termination of membership,for reasons other than failure to submit dues, shall be given the opportunityto appear in person before the Board of Directors before such determinationof termination is made. In the event the Board of Directors considerssuch termination of a member, such member shall be notified of a meetingdate no less than sixty (60) days prior to such meeting. The memberbeing considered for termination shall make a written request to appearat such meeting no less than thirty (30) days of the scheduled meetingdate. When feasible, a mutually agreed upon meeting date should bescheduled, however, such meeting date will be set at the sole discretionof the Board of Directors.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: Article III � Board of Directors

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: Section 1: Nominations

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: There shall be a minimum of TEN (10) and a maximumof NINETEEN (19) members of the Board of Directors of the association,all of whom shall be elected at an Annual Membership Meeting and shallbe valid members of the Association. There shall be the officersof the Board and up to FOURTEEN (14) directors, representing the officialstate PRT districts. Each Director shall represent no more than 20SCBBA members. Board membership is to be predominately filled by full member�Bed and Breakfasts� innkeepers; therefore, no more than two (2) full member�Historic Inn/Hotel� innkeepers may serve on the board at a time. A Nominating committee selected from the Board of Directors shall presenta slate of nominees or officers and additional directors to the membershipat least (30) days prior to the annual meeting. Nominations may alsobe made in writing to the Nominating Committee with the written agreementof the nominee, qualifications for nomination and accompanied by signaturesof three members of the Association at least thirty (30) days prior tothe annual meeting.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: Nominations will also be solicited from the generalmembership via the Association newsletter or other general mailing to themembership. No nominations will be accepted from the floor at theAnnual Meeting.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: The Nominating Committee shall consider geographicalrepresentation, population density, time for and interest in the governanceof the Association, and needed skills in choosing candidates for the slateto be presented to the members.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: All candidates shall be contacted by the NominatingCommittee and must signify, in writing, their willingness to serve beforethe Nomination Slate is submitted to the membership.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: Section 2: Elections

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: The membership shall elect a President,1st Vice-President, 2nd Vice-President, Secretary,

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: Treasurer and additional directors to a maximumof fourteen (14) on the proposed slate. Any director, either electedor appointed, may be removed from the Board of Directors or office by atwo-thirds vote of the membership at an annual meeting or special meetingcalled for this purpose. The outgoing President will be a memberof the Board of Directors for one year immediately following his or herterm of office.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: Section 3: Term of Office

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: The term of office for directors and officersshall be two (2) years. Directors shall serve on a staggered termbasis, with approximately one-half of the total number of directors beingelected annually, and may be re-elected for an addition tern or terms. Officers shall serve concurrently and may not serve more that two consecutiveterms (total of four years) in any one officer position.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: Vacancies for an unexpired term or unfilled positionson the Board of Directors may be, but are not required to be, except inthe case of officers, filled by the Board of Directors as long as thereare no less than five current directors. In the event that the positionof an officer becomes vacant, an Association Member, preferably an existingdirector, shall be elected by the Board of Directors at the next scheduledquarterly meeting to fill the position until the next Annual Meeting electionof directors and officers.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: Section 4: Meetings

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: Meetings of the Board of Directors shall be heldquarterly. These meetings are for the purpose of conducting business wherea vote of the general membership is not required. A quorum for aBoard meeting shall be 50% or more of the current number of directors andofficers.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: A schedule of the quarterly meetings shall bemade available to the general membership in some appropriate form onceeach year. No further notice is necessary unless the meeting schedulechanges.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: Board meetings are open to the general membership. Any Association Member may ask to be scheduled on the agenda at any boardmeeting.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: At open meetings of the Board, general Associationmembers may not participate unless a prior request to speak to a specificagenda item has been received by the Secretary.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: In no circumstance shall a general Associationmember vote on any Board action.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: Section 5: Voting

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: Each Director on the Board of Directors shallhave one vote. In the event of tie votes, the

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: President shall vote or abstain from voting asneeded to break the tie.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: Section 6: Attendance

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: Each regional director and officer shall attendall regular meetings of the Association. The reason for a plannedabsence from any Board or general meeting must be submitted to the Presidentor the President�s designate before the beginning of each meeting. The reason for an unplanned absence must be submitted no later than onweek after the missed meeting. The Executive Board will review thereasons for absence and declare each absence either acceptable or unacceptable.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: Section 7: Removal from Office

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: In addition to other provisions of the By-Laws(Article III, Section 2), any officer or regional director may be removedfrom office for any of the following causes:

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: a) Failure to attend, withoutacceptable reason as determined by the Executive

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: Board, two (2)consecutive regular of special Board meetings or assigned

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: committee meetingswithin any twelve (12) month period. Removal for this

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: cause will beeffective when the Executive Board rules the second absence

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: unacceptable. The Board of Directors will consider a resignation to have

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: been tenderedand accepted.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: b) Failure to fulfill the responsibilityof the position as specified in the By-Laws.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: Removal for thiscause must be determined by a 2/3 vote of the entire Board

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: of Directors.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: c) Wrongdoing or misconduct in handlingAssociation affairs. Removal for this

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: cause mustbe determined by a 2/3 vote of the entire Board of Directors

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: Any officer or regional representative who isto be considered for removal due to causes identified in item b) or c)of this Section shall be entitled to:

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: � Ten (10) days advance notice by mailof the proposed removal. Such notice must state the meetingtime and place at which such removal is to be voted upon by the Board ofDirectors.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: � Appear before and be heard at the meetingof the Board of Directors where removal is considered.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: Article IV

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: Duties of the Officers and Regional Directors

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: Section 1: President

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: The President shall preside over all meetingsof the Association; shall have general and

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: active management of the affairs of the Association and shall see thatthe provisions of

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: the annual budget and resolution votedby the membership or Board of Directors are

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: carried out.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: The President shall appoint members of standingcommittees of the Board except the Executive Committee and the NominatingCommittee which is appointed by the Board of Directors.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: Section 2: 1st Vice-President

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: The 1st Vice-President shall have the authorityand responsibilities of the President in the President�s absence. It shall be the responsibility of this individual to attend all regularmeeting of the Association and to represent the Association throughoutthe State, as the Associations� business may require at the direction ofthe President. This individual will be responsible for membershipof the association, both membership renewals and processing new memberapplications. He/She is also responsible for By-Law revisions andmay be appointed as an ex-officio, voting member of those committees, asdeemed necessary by the President.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: Section 3: 2nd Vice-President

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: The 2nd Vice-President shall have the authorityand responsibility for insuring the inspection policies of the Associationare followed and to recommend to the board any changes that are felt necessary. It shall also be the responsibility of this individual to attend all regularmeeting of the Association and to represent the Association throughoutthe state, as the Association�s business may require at the direction ofthe President. He/She may be appointed as an ex-officio, voting memberof those committees as deemed necessary by the President.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: Section 4: Secretary:

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: The Secretary shall attend all meetings of theBoard of Directors and shall record all true minutes of each meeting andkeep them in good order. Minutes of all meetings shall be availablefor review by Association members with reasonable notice given for theirperusal. The Secretary shall also maintain membership roster withthe help of the membership Vice-President, and shall chair the NominatingCommittee which prepares the slate of nominees for the Annual MembershipMeeting. The Secretary shall write and mail all meeting notices and correspondencefrom the board, and shall maintain all mailing lists. The secretaryshall be responsible for dissemination of the quarterly association newsletterand general membership announcements. When possible, minutes or asummary of Association Board meetings shall be included in any newslettersent to the general membership.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: Section 5: Treasurer

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: The Treasurer shall have custody of all Associationfunds and shall keep complete and accurate receipts and disbursement records,as well as deposit all monies and other assets in the name of the Association,using the services of a bank as designated by the Board of Directors. The Treasurer shall provide all such records to the Association and shallreport the financial status of the Association to the Board of Directorsquarterly and to the membership at the Annual Meeting.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: Each year prior to the Annual Meeting, the Treasurershall prepare an annual budget with the direction of the Board of Directors. This budget shall include the annual dues figures for the following yearto be approved at the Annual Meeting. The Treasurer shall mail outdues notices not later than November 1st for the following year. A roster of members with paid up dues will be those members listed in theannual directory and on the Association�s website.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: Section 6: Regional Directors

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: Each regional director shall be responsible forcommunications with the Association members in the representative�s designatedarea. It is the responsibility of each Regional Director to disseminateAssociation information to the designated Association members and to representtheir interests at meetings of the Board of Directors.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: Specific job responsibilities shall be identifiedin an Association document titled �Job Duties for a Regional Director.�

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: Article V - Committees

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: Section 1: Executive Committee

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: There shall be an Executive Committee which willconsist of the five officers of the Board of Directors as voting membersand which may include the immediate Past President as an ex-officio, non�voting member. The Executive committee shall have, and exercisein the intervals between meetings of the Board of Directors, all the powersof the board which may lawfully be delegated in the management of the businessand affairs of the Association.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: Three voting members of the Executive committeeshall constitute a quorum. It shall meet at the call of the President. The Secretary of the Association, or in his/her absence, a secretary pro-temporedchosen by the Executive Committee, shall keep a true record of all itsproceedings. Such records of these meetings shall always be receivedand approved by the Board of Directors.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: Section 2: Committee Appointments& Minutes

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: The President of the Board shall appoint all committees,except the Executive Committee, which is composed of the elected officersand the Nominating Committee which is appointed by the Board of Directors. Summary minutes of all committee meetings and work sessions shall be keptfor the record and filed with the Secretary within one (1) month of a givencommittee meeting or work session.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: Standing committees shall include one or moredirectors and may include members of the Association who are not directors.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: Section 3: Nominating Committee

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: The Secretary shall serve as the chairperson ofthe Nominating Committee, which shall represent all geographical areasin South Carolina. Two additional members of this committee shallbe selected from the Board of Directors each year. These membersshould be selected at the prior Annual Meeting.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: Article VI � Reports

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: Section 1: Fiscal Year

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: The fiscal year shall begin on the firstday of March and shall end on the last day of

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: February.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: Section 2: Financial Report

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: A written Financial Report, based on the Treasurer�saudited accounts, shall be presented to the membership at the Annual Meeting. The indicated audit shall be conducted by three current directors priorto the Annual Meeting.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: Section 3: President�s Report

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: The president shall present an annual oral andmake available a written report to the membership reviewing the year endedand make such forecast for the coming year as may seem reasonable.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: Section 4: Annual Budget

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: A proposed annual budget shall be submitted tothe Board of Directors by the Treasurer at a meeting prior to the AnnualMeeting for action by the membership at the Annual Meeting. Thisshall include proposed dues figures for the coming year.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: Section 5: By-Laws Revision

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: Any proposed revision of the By-Laws shall alsobe submitted to the Board of Directors by an ad hoc committee establishedfor this purpose sixty (60) days prior to the Annual Membership Meetingfor action by the members.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: Section 6: Proposed Slate of Officers andDirectors

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: A proposed slate of officers and directors forthe coming year shall be presented by the Nominating Committee to the Boardof Directors sixty (60) days prior to the Annual Membership Meeting foraction by the members.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: Article VII

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: Execution of Instruments

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: Section 1: Drafts, Checks and Orders

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: All drafts and checks shall be drawn on an Associationaccount by the Treasurer via an authorized Check Requisition Form signedby the President prior to payment.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: Section 2: Execution of Contracts

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: The President may execute any contract, conveyanceor other instrument on behalf of the Association with the prior approvalof the Board of Directors. Such approval may be in the form of anapproved budget item, a resolution voted approval at a membership meeting,or other authority that lies within the provisions of these By-Laws

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: Section 3: Association Obligations and Loans

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: No one officer or agent of the Associationshall have the authority to obligate the

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: Association for more than $200 in excess of abudget line item without prior approval of the Board of Directors.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: No loans shall be made using Association fundsand no evidence of indebtedness shall be issued in its name unless authorizedby a vote of the membership as noted above. All obligations musthave approval of at least one director, one member of the board, and thePresident.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: Article VIII

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: By-Laws Amendments

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: Section 1: Amendment Process

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: These By-Laws may be amended or other By-Lawsadopted by the written approval of two-thirds of the members present atthe Annual Meeting, or by approval of two-thirds of the full membershipon a mail-in ballot at times other than the Annual Meeting.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: Section 2: By-LawsCommittee

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: The 1st Vice-President will chair the ad-hoc By-LawsCommittee formed prior to the Annual Meeting each year. Written requestsfor By-Laws revisions will be received by the Vice-President and the By-LawsCommittee who will consider revisions to be presented at the Annual Meeting.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: Article IX

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: Distribution of Assets on Dissolution

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: No member, director or officer of the Association,nor any private individual, shall be entitled to share in the distributionof any of the assets of the Association upon dissolution of the Association.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: Upon dissolution, all the remaining assets ofthe Association shall be distributed by the Board of Directors for identicaluses and purposes to any other organization which would then qualify asa similar non-profit hospitality association. Any such assets notso disposed of, shall be disposed of by the Superior Court of the countyin which the principal office of the Association is then located to anysuch organization which is operated as a non-profit hospitality association.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: Article X

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: Idemnification of Directors and Officers

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: Each director or officer now or hereafter servingthe Association, and each person who at the request of or on behalf ofthe Association is now serving or hereafter serves as trustee, directoror officer of any other association, whether for profit or not for profit,shall be indemnified by the Association against expenses actually and necessarilyincurred by him/her in connection with the defense of any action, suitor proceeding in which he/she is made a party by reason of being or havingbeen such director or officer.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: Appendix A

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: These Appendices, SCBBA Full Membership Criteriaand Associate Membership Criteria are herein incorporated under the provisionsof these By-Laws.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: Appendix B

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: Membership Application Procedure

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: 1. Prospective members shall submit a writtenapplication which includes:

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: a) A non-refundable application of twenty-fivedollars ($25.00) which shall be part of the Membership Dues submitted withthe application.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: b) As appropriate and if requested, photocopiesof the B&B�s licenses and certificates.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: c) Permission for an initial and annual evaluativesite visit, by virtue of submission of an application or renewal application,for an SCBBA Site Visit Team.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: d) Verification that B&B maintains appropriatecommercial insurance, including property and liability coverage, as lodgingproperty.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: e) A photograph/s of B&B�s exterior (optionalinterior photographs).

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: f) A line drawing/illustration of the B&B.(optional).

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: g) Five (5) brochures and rate cards/sheets.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: h) An up-to-date Data Form on file with the SCBBA.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: 2. On receipt of the application, the membershipchairperson shall advise the appointed Site Visit Team of the needed sitevisit. This team shall, without delay, arrange a visit to the applicant�sB&B. The inspection shall cover all standards for membership.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: 3. The application and report of findings fromthe Site Visit Ream shall be reviewed and voted upon by the Board of Directorswith acceptance by a simple majority vote. The applicant shall benotified of the findings of the site inspection and the result of the vote.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: 4. Membership Expired or Lapsed:

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: Memberships lapsed for one year or more will necessitatereapplication and inspection, with all required fees payable at time ofapplication.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: Articles I through III of this document prevailupon acceptance of the application by the Association or its representatives.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: 5. Membership Transfer/Extension:

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: In order for a member Inn to be eligible for membershiptransfer or extension in the event of sale of the property:

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: a) Property must closes in the first six monthsof the SCBBA fiscal year. After that, new membership rules apply.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: b) Member inn must notify Association Presidentand/or the Association Board of Directors of sale and closing date.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: c) Association President or Board of Directorswill submit letter defining criteria and rules for transfer to be presentedto new owner at or shortly after the time of sale.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: d) All dues paid by original owner shall be consideredpayment for the fiscal year.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: e) New owner must submit application and fees,as appropriate, within 60 days of property closing, along with copies ofall applicable licenses, zoning, inspections, etc., as required of newmembers.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: f) During the application period, the new ownerwill be considered a �pending member� with all such privileges and restrictionsentitled under that classification.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
content: Appendix C

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td center table tbody tr td p font span
